page.title: 09ECOLOGY
page.content: The area is milder & has less snow than surrounding districts but has more rain than nearer the coast. Rivers are clear & clean except when filled with stormwater & support declining numbers of trout & salmon. Water meadows are often flooded after heavy rain & river banks have to be reinforced. Village springs still flow & 1 at least is in constant use in preference to Water Authority supply. There is a rich variety of birds, water fowl & flowers including the rare spotted orchid. Remnants of oak forests & deciduous trees are found, rowans & hazels being common. Many local footpaths which had become overgrown have been reopened this year. Bracken is a problem to the farmers. Happily a few deciduous trees and hedges have been replanted.
